The facility is conducting regulated activity (dealing in animals) that is not covered by the current license (a breeder
license). Over time, the facility's business model has changed and they have started buying and reselling animals.
Currently, the facility only holds a license that allows for the sale of animals bred and born on property. A new license
must be obtained prior to a change in ownership, location, activities, or animals. Failure to notify Animal Care at least 90-
days prior to a change in activities prevents the licensee from obtaining a new license prior to acting as a dealer. It is
important that the facility hold the correct license that represents the covered activities being conducted to ensure
accurate tracing and movement of animals between facilities to ensure compliance with the Animal Welfare Act. Correct
by 20 March 2024 by applying for and receiving a dealer (Class B) license from USDA before conducting dealer activities
such as buying and reselling of animals.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
